meanings.definition: To turn or rotate the palm or sole of the foot downward or inward.
meanings.sent1: She pronates her foot when she walks, making her steps more stable.
meanings.sent2: He pronates his hand to show the correct way to hold the racket.
meanings.sent3: The ballet dancer pronates her foot dramatically, adding flair to her performance.
meanings.sent4: The chef pronates the pan expertly, flipping the food with precision.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's coach emphasizes the importance of how to pronate the body during certain moves.

meanings.definition: To cause to assume a prone position.
meanings.sent1: The nurse gently pronates the patient for a better view of the injury.
meanings.sent2: During the exercise class, the instructor pronates the participants for a relaxation pose.
meanings.sent3: The yoga teacher jokingly pronates the students for a 'nap time' session.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the villain pronates the captured hero to keep him under control.
meanings.sent5: The dog trainer pronates the puppies during training to teach them to lie down on command.
